args: Please note that this story contains spoilers\nfor the ＂Faith Forsaken (Part Two)＂ event.
We are apostles:\nthe executors of Ilia's will.
I'd heard tales about some kind of secret\nsociety from the Northern Church, but I\nnever thought you were REAL!
You know us? Aw, I'm honored.
But I think it's high time you told us\neverything ELSE you know...
We are apostles, one hand of the Goddess,\nand we shall administer Her authority!
I can't believe he got full marks—again!
Welcome back, all! It sounds like you\nall had a fine time out there.
We sure did. In fact, we were just talking\nabout yesterday's mission.
The one where you went to infiltrate\na secret society with Basileus?
Yes. It turns out they're a shady group\nthat's trying to create artificial humans.
I heard members of the Church may have\nbeen involved as well?

Indeed there were. And given the size of
the group and the danger they posed, we
moved to learn as much as we could
about them and take them out.
So I heard. But as I was deemed unready\nfor such a mission, hearing was all I did.
But tell me, what happened out there?\nYou couldn't have failed, right?
Quite the opposite—we got the info and\nthen blew the doors off the place both\nfiguratively and literally.
Huzzah! I knew you could do it!
Er, but then why is Faris so upset?
He's just annoyed at the difference in skill\nbetween himself and Basileus—even\nthough he handled himself brilliantly.

No need to put on a tough act just 'cause
the rookie's here. But if it makes you feel
better, you ain't the only one who feels
about two inches tall around Basileus.
Wait. YOU feel like that, Nevin?!
Basileus is the big leagues, kid.\nEven Papa Bear's gotta look up to him.
He's even greater than I thought...

I mean, I'd heard all kinds of tales about
his skill, but as I have never interacted
with the man, I was unsure how much
stock to put in them.
But I think all of you are incredible,\nso if you hold him in such high esteem,\nhe must be even better than I thought!
If you really want to know, you can get\nyour info from the horse's mouth.\nHere he is now.
Thank you for your fine work, Basileus!
I am beyond honored to meet you!\nI mean, it's all so sudden, so I'm not\nsure I'm ready, but, um...
You are Pinon, yes? In what way do you\nnot feel yourself to be ready?
She's an admirer of yours, big guy.\nIt's making me kiiinda jealous...
It's just that I have looked up to you and\nyour accomplishments for some time now.

So, um, if you're willing, might you
perhaps teach me how to prepare for
missions? Or maybe combat techniques?
Or just whatever you feel like doing!
I appreciate the enthusiasm, but I fear\nthere is nothing you can learn from me.
I don't know what you may have heard\nabout me, but my way of doing things\ncomes from experience alone.
So even if I taught you, you couldn't put\nit to any kind of practical use.

My apologies. Now, may I see you for a
moment, Nevin? I need to ask you your
thoughts on something that happened
during yesterday's mission.

Don't worry about that too much, Pinon;
he's not exactly the warmest guy in the
room. Also, he's like that with everyone,
so you shouldn't—
He's so modest that he won't show off his\nown strength. And he's so stoic that he\nrefuses to join in on small talk!
I see now why he leads the apostles,\nbut I must learn how he got that way...
And I have to know more about HIM!
So you tried looking into Basileus\nand didn't learn a thing, eh?
There's no need to be so down, Pinon!
His defenses are simply too good!\nAnytime I even call out to the man,\nhe slips away before I know it.

And in all the reports I read, he's always
throwing everything he has into every
mission. How did he ever get to be so
darn strong?!
I am honored you would look into me\nwith such fervor.
Looks like he heard everything you just\nsaid about your stalkerish behavior.
Nooo! I wasn't trying to be a stalker!\nI'm so sorry, Basileus!
Despite the high esteem you hold me in,\nI am really not so amazing as all that.
I have experience—that's all. And if you\nkeep going on missions, someday you\nwill possess such experience for yourself.
No! You're selling yourself short! You're\nthe leader of the apostles! You're their\nvery best! You're INCREDIBLE!
You're smart, strong, brave, and a man\nof impeccable character!
You don't constantly slack off, and you\ndon't try to assign people points!\nThere is no one I'd rather look up to!
I'm deducting all of your points.
What?! I mean, no! You've got it all\nwrong! I wasn't talking about YOU people,\nI was talking about...um...OTHER people!
Your worldview is still so narrow, Pinon.
Although your constant following me\nHAS made you slightly better at hiding\nyour presence.
Still, there remains room for improvement.\nKeep working at it.
Oh...he knew what I was doing even before\nhe overheard me here. And I thought I'd\nbeen doing a good job being sneaky...

Ugh. This is so embarrassing. I just want
to dig a hole and then crawl in the hole
and then pull the dirt back over the hole
so I can die there.
Don't sweat it, kid. Like Ryszarda said,\nhe's like that to everybody.
Every time I see how skilled he is,\nI can't help but realize just how terrifying\nhe would be as an enemy.
I'm glad he's on our side.
Will I ever reach that level?
Our preparations for Satan's resurrection\nare coming along nicely.
Excellent. I leave the rest to you.
(No one should look up to someone\nlike me.)
(But there is something I wish to achieve\nabove all else...)
This is for her sake, too, and I WILL see\nit done.
